mean_en: a formal statement of an opinion agreed on by a committee or a council, especially by means of a vote; the act of solving or settling a problem, disagreement, etc.; the quality of being resolute or determined; a firm decision to do or not to do something; the power of a computer screen, printer, etc. to give a clear image, depending on the size of the dots that make up the image
sentence: She made a resolution to read all of these English novels in just one week.
sentence_trans: 她下定决心要在一周内读完所有这些英文小说。
word_etyma: re不 + solut松开 + ion名词后缀，构成抽象名词 → 不解决就不松开 → resolution决心；溶解
